So, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth, eh? I liked it a lot. 150 hours a lot. I big cried at least twice and welled up, much like a well, many other times. As much as I’d like to wax emotional about the plot and characters in an endless lifestream-of-consciousness ramble, articles need both headlines and subjects (truly an act of conspiratorial violence targeted at my personal dadaist instincts). So, let’s talk about just the minigames, because I think they’re wonderful for all sort of reasons that might not be immediately apparent.  Naturally, big spoiler potential ahead if, like me, you consider everything you haven’t experienced in the RPG game a spoiler.
I think one of OG Final Fantasy’s 7 best tricks is how it doesn’t just dish out its strangest distractions as a palette cleanser to the main meal of its action and drama, but actively works them in as an indispensable part of the menu. It also does this all without a shred of shame or self-consciousness, resulting in a cinematic video game with no inner turmoil or resentment toward either part of that equation - a characteristic I feel is suffered from by many of the games for which FF7 lead the way. Take the Gold Saucer. It’s an excuse to dick around and ride motorbikes, sure, but it’s also an essential story beat while the party takes time to relax and enjoy each other’s company away from the stress of travel and battle.
 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s minigames are each a new sensory organ for its many novelties

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I think its reasonable to say that the term ‘fetch quest’ is well passed the point of being a neutral descriptor and has moved firmly into the realm of full pejorative. You won't see many games tout ‘epic fetch quests’ on their Steam Page, and you’re much more likely to hear the term lodged between the words ‘not a bloody’ and ‘again’, like two slices of exasperation-enriched bread stuffed with a shit-tier filling. Cucumber, perhaps. Not so, at least not for me, when it comes to Dragon's Dogma 2. The action RPG game has more or less solved the fetch quest problem. All it took, it turns out, was some interesting world design.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon’s Dogma 2 proves that fetch quests are good as long as the space in between is interesting

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Have you said hello to our new staff writer, Nic Reuben yet? You should say hi to Nic. You've already been reading him on RPS for years as a freelancer, but he's ours now. Is us now. In other news, hey, it's a long weekend! Most of us (sorry, Alice Bee) have Friday off and Monday too, so expect us to return properly on Tuesday. Until then, what are you playing this Easter weekend? Here's what we're clicking on!
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this Easter weekend?

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Head over to the Epic Games Store on April 4th and you'll be able to grab The Outer Worlds: Spacer's Choice Edition and Thief (2014) for free and to keep forever. Like a thief! 

 
Read more
articles.title: The Outer Worlds and Thief are free from Epic next week

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Rhythm shooter Metal: Hellsinger has you circle-strafing Quake-style level layouts at high-speed while you shoot demons to the beat. I meet the news that it's getting a VR version this year with some trepidation, therefore. Do I really want to vomit on the beat?

 
Read more
articles.title: Metal: Hellsinger VR re-tools the rhythm shooter for headbanging in a headset

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Earlier today, megacorp Embracer announced they were selling Borderlands developer Gearbox to Take-Two. During an investor call about the divestment, CEO Lars Wingefors confirmed that this brought an end to the restructuring process Embracer announced last year. He was also asked whether this meant Embracer had plans to start acquiring other studios again.

Wingefors said it was "way too early" to restart "the M&A engines."

 
Read more
articles.title: Embracer say their restructure is over, but it's "too early" to start acquiring studios again

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Sega Of America employees have become the first a major US video games studio to ratify a union contract. The contract covers guarantees minimum yearly pay increases for around 150 staff through 2026.

 
Read more
articles.title: Sega Of America staff have ratified a union contract, the first to do so at a major US studio

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V normě IEEE 754–2008 nalezneme kromě klasických numerických formátů i popis typů s desítkovým základem exponentu. Jedná se o typy Decimal32, Decimal64 a Decimal128. Ty jsou taktéž podporovány některými překladači céčka.
articles.title: Kouzlo datových typů Decimal32, Decimal64 a Decimal128

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Zdeněk Brůna)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC dnes spustilo veřejné testování aukce domén, která poběží od května letošního roku. Dostanou se do ní domény na konci svého životního cyklu. Technický ředitel CZ.NIC vysvětluje, jak budou fungovat.
articles.title: CZ.NIC spouští aukce domén, běží veřejné testování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: Continuation Flood a xz/lzma už sotva dýchají, podíváme se tedy raději na jeden ironický, jeden ikonický a jeden revoltující únik informací. Projdeme kreativní i fádní SQL injekce a nahlédneme do temnějších zákoutí protokolů.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: když utíkají data místo vězňů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Vydání beta verze Ubuntu 24.04 bylo kvůli bezpečnostním problémům o týden odloženo. Linux Mint 22 bude používat PipeWire jako výchoz zvukový server. Nadace FreeBSD dělá významné pokroky ve vývoji bezdrátových ovladačů.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04 beta odloženo, Linux Mint 22 s PipeWirem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Dnes bych se rád podíval na další typ modelu pro sémantickou segmentaci obrázků, a tím je DeepLabV3. Důvodem, proč jsem si vybral právě tento, je použití bloku Spatial Pyramid Pooling a s ním spojené Atrous Convolution.
articles.title: Segmentace MRI mozku – DeepLabV3 model

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Nově objevený útok zneužívá zprávu Continuation v protokolu HTTP/2, kterou je možné zahltit server a způsobit jeho výpadek. Zranitelná je řada implementací, včetně Apache HTTP Serveru.
articles.title: Continuation Flood vystavuje implementace HTTP/2 útokům DoS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dalším článku budou popsány funkce s proměnným počtem parametrů, datové typy tabulka a pole, práce s řetězci (včetně jejich interpolace) a nezapomeneme se zmínit ani o některých vlastnostech překladače shinec.
articles.title: Jazyk Shine: funkce, datové typy a práce s řetězci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Karel Kulhavý)
articles.description:
Minule jsme snížili šum preemfází a dnes budeme výsledný analogový signál
kódovat do digitálního nosiče a ten pak překódovávat do ASCII-artu
kompatibilního s řetězci v uvozovkách ve zdrojáku v jazyce C.
articles.title: Kódování již preemfázovaného analogového zvuku do ASCII-artu C

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Svatopluk Vít)
articles.description: Pamětníci pamatují komunikační aplikace pro tzv. instant messaging – podporovaly protokoly jako ICQ nebo Jabber. Existovaly aplikace integrující více kanálů do jednoho rozhraní. Je však něco takového k dispozici dnes?
articles.title: Ferdium: všechny sociální sítě na jednom místě a multiplatformně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V pravidelné středeční softwarové sondě si představíme nástroj pro přepínání mezi verzemi běhových prostředí, budeme monitorovat certifikáty a vyzkoušíme pomocníka pro nastavení více konfigurací pro přesměrování portů v kubectl.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (3. 4. 2024): hlídejte si správný čas

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 6. června se v Ballingově sále Národní technické knihovny v pražských Dejvicích uskuteční konference Den IPv6 2024, kterou společně organizují sdružení CESNET, CZ.NIC a NIX.CZ.
articles.title: Den IPv6 2024: přihlašování prezentací je otevřeno už jen do konce týdne

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Windows 10 a 11 stále umožňují změnu výchozího prohlížeče uživatelským zásahem v nastavení. Nově však od únorových aktualizací Windows 10 (KB5034763) a Windows 11 (KB5034765) nefunguje změna výchozího prohlížeče zapsáním do registru nebo nějakým programem (ten také mění registr). Patrně jde o snahu zamezit nežádoucím změnám výchozího prohlížeče.
articles.title: Windows 10 a 11 mají ovladač, který blokuje změnu výchozího prohlížeče

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Adam)
articles.description: Na začátku roku 2017 vešel v platnost zákon o hazardních hrách a později téhož roku také metodický pokyn, dle kterého mají poskytovatelé služby přístupu k internetu zamezit přístupu k vybraným internetovým stránkám, které zveřejňuje ministerstvo v seznamu nepovolených internetových her.
articles.title: Seznamy blokovaných webů se rozrůstají

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Nginx je dnes přibližně na třetině web serverů na internetu a toto číslo stále roste. Je výkonný, spolehlivý, má spoustu funkcí a dobře se spravuje. Pokud potřebujete dobrý web server pro svůj projekt, bude Nginx správnou volbou.
articles.title: Nasaďte moderní web server s Nginx (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ke stažení je nová verze FFmpeg 7.0 s názvem Dijkstra. Mezi nejzajímavější změny pro uživatele jsou nativní dekodér VVC (v současné době experimentální, dokud nebude proveden další fuzzing), podpora IAMF nebo vícevláknová utilita ffmpeg. Právě podpora vícevláknové utility FFmpeg znamenala největší refaktorizací kódu za mnoho let a jde o skvělou zprávu, vzhledem k rostoucímu počtu jader procesorů platformy x86_64 a AArch64.
articles.title: FFmpeg 7.0 Dijkstra přináší vícevláknovou řádkovou utilitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výchozí hodnota vm.max_map_count je 64k a limituje, kolik různých mmap (memory map) může jeden proces použít. To vypadá jako hodně, ale pro některé Windows hry hrané přes Proton to nestačí. Mezi nimi je například DayZ, Hogwarts Legacy a Counter Strike 2.
articles.title: Zvýšení vm.max_map_count nejen kvůli hrám v Protonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Chystaný Linux Mint 22 bude založený na Ubuntu 24.04 LTS a bude mít výchozí zvukový server PipeWire. Dále bude nově podporovat formát Deb822 pro soubory /etc/apt/sources.list.d/.
articles.title: Chystaný Linux Mint 22 bude mít PipeWire a podporu JPEG XL

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Autoři souborového systému Bcachefs poslali ve středu do jádra 6.9-rc3 robustní kód pro opravy. Pokud máte souborový systém poškozený, tak by ho to mělo opravit včetně rekonstrukce většiny metadat. Může se stát, že oprávnění, vlastníci a časové značky budou špatně, ale data by měla být čitelná.
articles.title: Bcachefs má robustní kód pro opravy, dokáže rekonstruovat většinu metadat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: PCI-SIG již od loňského léta pracuje na specifikace PCIe 7.0. Loni vyšla specifikace ve verzi 0.3, v úterý pak ve verzi 0.5.  Finální specifikace je očekávána v příštím roce.
articles.title: Specifikace PCIe 7.0 vyšla ve verzi 0.5, finální bude za rok

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili Incus 6.0 LTS, což je je systémový správce virtuálních počítačů, který vyvinul a spravuje stejný tým, který vytvořil LXD. Společnost Canonical totiž před časem změnila licenci LXD a upravila podmínky přispívání do projektu.
articles.title: Vyšel Incus 6.0 LTS, komunitní fork správce kontejnerů LXD

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři javascriptového engine V8, používaného v prohlížečích Chrome a Chromium, oznámili, že jejich paměťový sandbox po třech letech od zahájení vývoje už nemá přívlastek experimentální. Sandbox V8 je nyní zařazen do programu VRP (Vulnerability Reward Program) pro Chrome. I když je stále třeba vyřešit řadu problémů, než se stane silnou bezpečnostní hranicí, je zařazení do VRP důležitým krokem správným směrem, vysvětlují vývojáři.
articles.title: Sandbox v javascriptovém enginu V8 už není experimentální

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po letech používání v Ubuntu ve variantách Server a Cloud začalo Ubuntu 23.10 využívat Netplan, což je deklarativní software pro konfiguraci sítě. Po sedmi letech vývoje vyšel Netplan 1.0 a podle společnosti Canonical je připraven k použití na serverech i stolních počítačích.
articles.title: Netplan 1.0 je připraven pro nasazení v Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Přesně podle plánu dnes vyšlo OpenBSD 7.5. Vylepšuje virtualizaci VMM/VMD, lépe pracuje s víceprocesorovými systémy, vylepšuje podporu SoC od firem Allwinner a Rockchip, přidává offload některých akcí na síťové karty a přidává podporu dalších bezdrátových síťovek. Vylepšena byla také podpora IPSec a BGP včetně RPKI.
articles.title: OpenBSD 7.5 zlepšuje práci se sítí a virtualizací

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po úspěšném pilotním projektu se severoněmecká spolková země Šlesvicko-Holštýnsko rozhodla přejít z operačního systému Microsoft Windows a kancelářského balíku Microsoft Office na Linux, LibreOffice a další svobodný software. Výměna se týká 30 000 počítačů používaných v místní samosprávě. O přechodu se mluví už od roku 2020.
articles.title: Severoněmecké Šlesvicko-Holštýnsko přejde na Linux a LibreOffice

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google na svém Open-Source Blogu představil knihovnu Jpegli pro kódování a dekódování formátu JPEG. Zachovává zpětnou kompatibilitu se standardním formátem a podle benchmarků zároveň nabízí až 35% zlepšení kompresního poměru pro kompresi s vysokou kvalitou.
articles.title: Google uvolnil knihovnu Jpegli, která nabízí až 35% zlepšení komprese JPEG

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Národní bezpečnostní tým CSIRT.CZ zveřejnil výroční zprávu [PDF], která přináší kromě shrnutí nejdůležitějších aktivit týmu nebo meziročního srovnání kybernetických incidentů také bližší pohled na problematiku rostoucího phishingu v doméně .CZ.
articles.title: CSIRT.CZ vydal výroční zprávu, rychle roste počet phishingů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Google v úterý oznámila, že v prohlížeči Chrome testuje novou funkci nazvanou Device Bound Session Credentials (DBSC), která pomáhá chránit uživatele před krádežemi souborů cookie. Přibývá totiž útoků malware, který uživatelům krade soubory cookie. To pak útočníkům umožňuje obejít ochranu vícefaktorového ověřování (MFA) a získat neoprávněný přístup k online účtům.
articles.title: Chrome testuje novou ochranu proti krádežím souborů cookie

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Komunita okolo projektu Redict oznámila vydání Redict 7.3.0, což je první stabilní verze forku databáze Redis 7.2.4.1. Původní Redis nedávno změnil licenci a komunitou už není považován za svobodný software. Redict tedy vytvořil klon, který je uvolněn pod svobodnou licencí GNU LGPL. Naše volba licence vyvažuje tento problém s potřebami komerčních uživatelů – licenci jsme zvolili částečně proto, abychom zajistili, že poskytovatelé cloudových služeb budou moci i nadále nabízet Redict svým zákazníkům, píší vývojáři v oznámení.
articles.title: Redict 7.3.0 je prvním vydáním svobodného forku databáze Redis

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Nativní podpora pro Microsoft Exchange patří již řadu let mezi nejčastěji požadované vlastnosti. Vývojáři nyní na podpoře intenzivně pracují a nyní dokončili práce na automatickém objevování (Autodiscovery) Exchange a konfiguraci účtu pomocí OAuth. Kromě toho vyřešili načítání a vykreslování všech složek.
articles.title: Thunderbird dělá pokroky v kompatibilitě s Exchange

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Úmyslná infiltrace backdoorovaných upstreamových tarballů XZ do repozitáře Debianu Sid, která před několika dny umožnila vzdálený přístup přes SSH bez ověření, vyvolala v linuxové komunitě bouřlivou debatu a v distribucích pak hloubkovou analýzu škod.
articles.title: Debian se rozhodl odložit vydání verze 12.6 kvůli analýze dopadů backdooru v XZ

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tchaj-wan zažil nejsilnější zemětřesení za posledních nejméně 25 let. Došlo k narušení infrastruktury, pádu budov i ztrátám na životech. Země hraje významnou roli v globálním dodavatelském řetězci čipů, protože je domovem největšího světového výrobce čipů, společnosti TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co), která dodává čipy společnostem Apple a Nvidia.
articles.title: Tchajwanské zemětřesení zasáhlo výrobu čipů, výpadek by měl být jen krátkodobý

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Richard Hughes se na blogu vyjádřil k bezpečnostnímu problému v XZ vzhledem k projektu Fwupd. Ten slouží k automatické aktualizaci firmware uvnitř linuxových počítačů. Nástroj si pravidelně stahuje 9,5MB soubor ve formátu XML. V zákulisí se vlastně děje to, že knihovna libxmlb načte volitelně komprimovaná metadata a poté je fwupd použije k vyhledání nových aktualizací pro konkrétní hardware, vysvětluje autor projektu.
articles.title: Fwupd přechází z XZ na Zstd, kromě důvěry získá také lepší kompresi

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Podle původního plánu měla zítra vyjít betaverze Ubuntu 24.04 Noble Numbat. Vydání ale bylo posunuto o týden kvůli bezpečnostním problémům v projektu XZ a nutnosti preventivně všechny balíčky znovu překompilovat v čistém prostředí. To nám poskytuje jistotu, že žádné binárky v našich sestaveních nemohly být touto hrozbou ovlivněny, píše se v oznámení.
articles.title: Beta připravovaného Ubuntu 24.04 se odkládá o týden kvůli problému s XZ

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Joshua Strobl, autor desktopového prostředí Budgie, zaslal do projektu Fedora návrh na změnu výchozího uživatelského prostředí. Navrhuje přechod na KDE Plasma, přičemž současné prostředí GNOME by se podle něj mělo přesunout do oddělené edice.
articles.title: Návrh přechodu Fedory Workstation na KDE Plasma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Intel v úterý zveřejnila provozní ztráty své divize výroby čipů v roce 2023 ve výši 7 miliard dolarů. To je větší ztráta než 5,2 miliardy dolarů provozních ztrát v předchozím roce, uvádí agentura Reuters. Tržby této části v roce 2023 činily 18,9 miliardy dolarů, což je o 31 % méně než v předchozím roce, kdy činily 27,5 miliardy dolarů.
articles.title: Intel odhalil provozní ztrátu z výroby čipů ve výši 7 miliard dolarů

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Huawei v Berlíně představila řešení v oblasti optických sítí. Vliv kompromitace záloh na výnosy z ransomwaru. Efektivní podnikání se bez edge computingu neobejde. Bezpečnost zůstává hlavní prioritou firem, mění se však priority financování správy IT.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Efektivní podnikání se bez edge computingu neobejde

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 14/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Poškytávání ve vzdálené galaxii upozorňuje astronomy na nové chování černých děr. Co je to abstraktní katalyzátor. ESA kříží ChatGPT a data o pozorování Země. Planety u pulzarů mohou mít polární záře.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Supravodivost i v silném magnetickém poli

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise představuje komplexní portfolio pro generativní umělou inteligenci. Ochrana proti sofistikovaným kybernetickým útokům vyžaduje vícevrstvou obranu. Počítače HP řady Z. Kvantové počítače a kybernetické hrozby.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Kvantové počítače a kybernetické hrozby

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Objevili nekonvenční supravodič, který se jako minerál nachází i v přírodě. Vědci z ÚOCHB útočí na limity molekulární paměti a otevírají dveře vývoji molekulárních čipů. Cisco s Microsoftem dosáhly při přenosu dat podmořským kabelem závratných 800 Gbps. Mořské proudy i pozemské klima prý ovlivňuje interakce s Marsem.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Přišli s novým nápadem, jak poznat, zda text napsala umělá inteligence

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Nikdo asi nebude diskutovat, že Windows a Office od Microsoftu je nákladný software, bez ohledu na to, kdo jste. Dokud si ale neuvědomíte kde koupit OEM licence, na které jsou mnohem větší slevy než je jinak obvyklé. Právě teď pro vás máme na Goodoffer24.com Windows 11 Pro, Office 2019 Professional a všechno mezi tím za skvělé ceny.
articles.title: Speciální jarní slevy na software, Windows 11 za €21 na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 13/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Linuxové distribuce Tails či OpenMediaVault povýšily na Debian „Bookworm“, GhostBSD pro změnu na FreeBSD 14. Rocky Linux má zvláštní komerční podporu. Tiny Core Linux je již 15 let starý. Accessible-Coconut je zajímavá distribuce pro uživatele s omezením zraku. KDE neon má oficiálně prostředí KDE Plasma 6. Vyšly aktualizované příručky Linux From Scratch. Občerstvená sestavení dostaly také další distribuce: Debian, IPFire, antiX, Ubuntu 22.04, Zentyal Server, GParted Live, Grml, Kali, Proxmox Mail Gateway či KaOS.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 6-9/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Dell AI Factory s technologií NVIDIA přináší firmám komplexní řešení umělé inteligence. Synology Media Event 2024 – zástupci Synology se po roce opět setkali s obchodními partnery. Americká vláda poskytne Intelu téměř 20 miliard dolarů na podporu výroby čipů v USA. S M Computers o CPU a GPU od AMD. Sophos Threat Report 2024: Hrozby pro malé a střední podniky. Objevte nový potenciál umělé inteligence: GenAI s vlastním datovým úložištěm.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Americká vláda poskytne Intelu téměř 20 miliard dolarů na podporu výroby čipů v USA

articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kde se berou gravitační vlny o extrémně nízkých frekvencích? Webbův a Hubbleův dalekohled se shodly, záhada Hubbleovy konstanty přetrvává. Thomsonův jev závisí na směru magnetického pole.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Umělá inteligence analyzovala vlastnosti temné energie

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Rivendell je open source řešení automatizace rozhlasového vysílání. Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na GitHubu pod licencí GPLv2. Vydána byla verze 4.2.0.
articles.title: Rivendell 4.2.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Příspěvek na blogu CZ.NIC informuje, že aukce domén se připravuje ke spuštění a aktuálně dobíhají poslední testy a ladění. Zapojit se lze do veřejného testování.
articles.title: CZ.NIC: Otestujte s námi aukce domén

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Uroš Popović experimentuje s Linuxem na Raspberry Pi Zero a dalším levném hardwaru, nejnovější příspěvek se věnuje sestavení a zavádění Linuxu na sotva pětidolarovém SoC Allwinner F1C100S.
articles.title: Mainline Linux na hardwaru za 5 dolarů

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Projekt PiVPN, tj. jednoduchý instalátor VPN serveru s podporou WireGuard a OpenVPN na Raspberry Pi, byl s nejnovější verzí 4.6.0 oficiálně ukončen. Projekt zůstane archivován na GitHubu.
articles.title: Projekt PiVPN byl s verzí 4.6.0 oficiálně ukončen

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na čem aktuálně pracují vývojáři GNOME a KDE? Pravidelný přehled novinek v Týden v GNOME a Týden v KDE.
articles.title: Týden v GNOME a Týden v KDE (5. dubna 2024)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Multimediální centrum Kodi (dříve XBMC) bylo vydáno v nové major verzi 21.0 "Omega". Nově také pro LG webOS TV. Knihovna FFmpeg byla povýšena na verzi 6. Podrobný přehled změn na GitHubu.
articles.title: Kodi 21.0 "Omega"

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Bareboat Necessities je projekt řešící open source DIY námořní počítače a palubní přístroje. Používá se linuxová distribuce  BBN Marine OS s předinstalovanými aplikacemi.
articles.title: Bareboat Necessities a BBN Marine OS

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Po půl roce vývoje od vydání verze 7.2 byla vydána nová verze 7.3 v Javě napsané aplikace pro komplexní návrh rozmístění nábytku a dalšího vybavení v interiérech Sweet Home 3D. Vyzkoušet lze online verzi.
articles.title: Sweet Home 3D 7.3

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description:
Kdo chce vyzkoušet KDE 1.1.2 na Debianu 13,
ke stažení je iso.
articles.title: KDE 1.1.2 na Debianu 13

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Knihovna FFmpeg byla vydána ve verzi 7.0 „Dijkstra“. V tomto vydání je nástroj ffmpeg nově vícevláknový, přibyl experimentální dekodér VVC v libavcodec a mnoho dalšího, viz seznam změn.
articles.title: FFmpeg 7.0 „Dijkstra“

articles.description: For those making use of AES-XTS crypto for the likes of disk and file encryption on x86_64 CPUs, the upcoming Linux 6.10 kernel cycle is bringing some very tantalizing improvements especially if you are running recent AMD and Intel processors. With AMD Zen 4 processors the benefits can be as much as 155% faster while even Intel Ice Lake and Sapphire Rapids server processors can enjoy 127~151% faster AES-XTS-256...
articles.title: Linux 6.10 AES-XTS For Disk/File Encryption As Much As ~155% Faster For AMD Zen 4 CPUs

articles.description: With a few weeks having passed since the KDE Plasma 6.0 desktop release along with some point releases for addressing initial fall-out, I've been meaning to run some Plasma 6.0 Linux gaming performance benchmarks. I'll have up some interesting metrics soon using Fedora 40 while for this initial article is a look at the KDE Plasma 6.0 gaming performance between the Wayland and X11 sessions atop KDE Neon. Then similarly are the results for GNOME Shell with its X11 and Wayland sessions.
articles.title: AMD Radeon Linux Gaming Performance At Parity Between KDE Plasma 6.0 X11 vs. Wayland

articles.description: Engineers at the KDAB consulting firm have begun experimenting with embedding the Rust-written Servo web engine inside Qt software using CXX-Qt...
articles.title: KDAB Working On Embedding Servo Web Engine Within Qt

articles.description: Following the launch last week of the AMD Ryzen Embedded 8000 Series, SolidRun today announced the Bedrock R8000 as the first industrial PCs designed around these new Ryzen Embedded 8000 series SoCs...
articles.title: SolidRun Launches Bedrock R8000 As First Industrial PCs With Ryzen Embedded 8000 Series

articles.description: With the upcoming Linux 6.10 kernel cycle, the RISC-V architecture code is seeing kernel-mode FPU. This kernel floating point support is needed for the AMDGPU kernel graphics driver and particular its DCN display code. In turn this should allow recent AMD Radeon graphics cards to work on RISC-V with display support using the company's open-source driver stack...
articles.title: RISC-V Adding Kernel-Mode FPU For Linux 6.10 To Enable Recent AMD Display Support

articles.description: It's been a long journey but Valve's Samuel Pitoiset has now enabled VK_EXT_shader_object support by default with Mesa's Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" for the upcoming Mesa 24.1 release...
articles.title: RADV Vulkan Driver Enables EXT_shader_object By Default With Mesa 24.1

articles.description: DTrace used to be one of the Solaris features long sought after by Linux developers but over time the Linux kernel tracing capabilities have improved and Oracle has been supporting DTrace on Linux now for years without too much fanfare. DTrace 2.0.0-1.14 was released this past week as the latest iteration of this user-space implementation that builds off the Linux kernel tracing functionality like BPF...
articles.title: Oracle Releases DTrace 2.0.0-1.14 For Linux Systems

articles.description: For those running the official Raspberry Pi OS on Raspberry Pi 4 and 5 series single board computers, the Mesa V3DV Vulkan driver is now shipping by default to provide for a better out-of-the-box experience...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi OS Now Shipping With Vulkan Support By Default

articles.description: Linux 6.9-rc3 is released and most notable are the Bcachefs fixes to which Torvalds quipped, "if you had a corrupted bcachefs filesystem you'd probably want this, and if you thought bcachefs was stable already, I have a bridge to sell you. Special deal only for you, real cheap." Plus various other fixes throughout...
articles.title: Linux 6.9-rc3 Released With Many Bcachefs Patches

articles.description: Similar to Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, Fedora 39, and other recent Linux distributions increasing its vm.max_map_count default in order to satisfy some Windows games running under Valve's Steam Play (Proton) and other memory-intensive software, Arch Linux is also increasing its default value...
articles.title: Arch Linux Increasing Its vm.max_map_count To Help Steam Play Games & Other Software

articles.description: While recently there has been more Linux distribution vendor interest in evaluating x86-64-v2 and/or x86-64-v3 baselines for future Linux distribution releases as well as offering optimized packages for higher x86-64 baselines either for x86-64-v3 with being able to assume AVX/AVX2 or in the x86-64-v4 level where AVX-512 is introduced, the prospect of x86-64 micro-architecture feature levels for future processors isn't clear...
articles.title: x86-64-v5? Questions Arise Over The Future Of x86-64 Micro-Architecture Feature Levels

articles.description: Framework Computer as the company behind the popular Framework 13 and Framework 16 upgradeable/modular laptops is hiring for an open-source firmware developer...
articles.title: Framework Hiring For Open-Source Firmware Development

articles.description: For confidential computing "CoCo" virtual machines where the VM host is assumed to be un-trusted and aims to be as isolated as possible, RdRand hardware random number generator instructions are one of the limited sources of entropy for guest VMs. Right now RdRand can fail and the CoCo guest VMs will continue to boot albeit with limited or no entropy to see the VM's random number generation. But being merged today as part of x86 fixes for Linux 6.9 is now requiring seeding RNG with RdRand for CoCo environments otherwise a kernel panic...
articles.title: CoCo VMs On Linux Will Now Panic If RdRand Is Broken To Avoid Catastrophic Conditions

articles.description: One of the latest areas being worked on for enabling Rust programming language use within the Linux kernel is for CPU frequency "CPUFreq" scaling drivers...
articles.title: Rust Bindings Are Being Worked On For Linux CPUFreq Drivers

articles.description: A new version of the Debian Policy Manual has been published that outlines the policy requirements for Debian around the package archive and various design matters of the platform...
articles.title: Debian Policy 4.7 Outlines Latest Packaging/System Guidelines

articles.description: Last month I wrote about the V3D kernel graphics driver preparing for 1MB "super pages" support to help boost the performance for this open-source Broadcom DRM driver most notably used by the latest Raspberry Pi single board computers. The latest iteration of these patches have now been posted for supporting both super pages and big pages...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi V3D Kernel Graphics Driver Prepares For Big & Super Pages To Boost Speed

articles.description: With the recent Mesa 24.1 support for Wayland explicit sync with Vulkan drivers, GNOME merging explicit sync support, Wayland-Protocols 1.34 introducing linux-drm-syncobj, and XWayland explicit sync also nearing the state of being merged, there's been much talk recently about Wayland explicit sync. KDE KWin developer Xaver Hugl has written a detailed blog post for those interested in the topic...
articles.title: KDE On The Importance Of Wayland Explicit Sync

articles.description: In addition to KDE's busy week of development work, GNOME developers have also been busy working on features like improving the systemd-homed integration and beginning to work on mock-ups for an OS installer...
articles.title: GNOME Improving Integration With systemd-homed, Mockups For An OS Installer

articles.description: KDE developers have had another busy week working on fixes for Plasma 6.0 while simultaneously preparing new features for Plasma 6.1...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6 Can Now Sync Your RGB-Backlit Keyboard With Your Desktop's Accent Color

articles.description: Back in 2022 Cloudflare began talking about replacing Nginx with their own in-house, Rust-written code called Pingora, talked about Pingora more in 2023, and then this past February made this Pingora framework open-source for creating reliable and fast networked systems. Today marks the first official release of Pingora with the v0.1 tag...
articles.title: Pingora 0.1 Released As Cloudflare's Rust Code For Reliable & Fast Networked Systems

articles.description: Wine 9.6 has just been issued as the newest bi-weekly development release for this open-source software to enjoy Windows games and applications under Linux...
articles.title: Wine 9.6 Adds Support For Advanced AVX Features In Register Contexts

articles.description: Veteran Linux kernel developer Peter Zijlstra is working to wrap-up feature work around the EEVDF kernel scheduler code...
articles.title: New EEVDF Linux Scheduler Patches Make It Functionally "Complete"

articles.description: The OpenZFS file-system has merged support for using multiple task queues (TaskQs) to enhance performance for multi-core systems...
articles.title: OpenZFS Merges Support For Using Multiple Task Queues To Increase Performance

articles.description: OpenBLAS 0.3.27 is out as the newest version of this prominent open-source Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS) library...
articles.title: OpenBLAS 0.3.27 Adds C-SKY Arch, Improved GEMM For AMD Zen & Sapphire Rapids Fixes

articles.description: Richard Hughes of Red Hat has published Fwupd 1.9.16 as the newest update to this open-source firmware updating solution for Linux systems that pairs with the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) for easy firmware redistribution...
articles.title: Fwupd 1.9.16 Adds Support For More USB Docks & Qualcomm Devices

articles.description: The very exciting FFmpeg 7.0 multimedia library has been released! FFmpeg 7.0 rolls out most notably the new native VVC decoder that is currently experimental for supporting Versatile Video Coding as well as introducing the multi-threaded FFmpeg CLI tool...
articles.title: FFmpeg 7.0 Released With Native VVC Decoding & Multi-Threaded CLI

articles.description: Following the Intel Linux kernel graphics driver patches last month adding two new DG2/Alchemist PCI IDs that when digging through the Intel Compute Runtime sources were confirmed as the Arc Graphics A580E and A750E, the Mesa OpenGL/Vulkan drivers have now added support for these new graphics processors...
articles.title: Mesa Adds PCI IDs For Intel Arc Graphics A580E & A750E

articles.description: Theo de Raadt has released OpenBSD 7.5 as the newest version of this security-focused BSD operating system. With OpenBSD 7.5 there is a number of improvements for ARM (AArch64) hardware, never-ending kernel optimizations and other tuning work, countless package updates, and other adjustments to this popular BSD platform...
articles.title: OpenBSD 7.5 Released - Faster Performance For Many-Core ARM Servers

articles.description: OpenCL 3.0 debuted back in 2020 and while we haven't heard talks of any major revision on the horizon, it does continue to see new point releases. Released on Thursday was OpenCL 3.0.16 that adds one new extension while finalizing eight formerly provisional extensions...
articles.title: OpenCL 3.0.16 Released With One New Extension, Semaphores & External Memory Finalized

articles.description: Following up on their tweet earlier this week that they would be working to open-source more of their GPU software stack and hardware documentation, AMD now says they will be releasing documentation followed by the source code for their Micro-Engine Scheduler (MES) IP block found within Radeon GPUs...
articles.title: AMD Working To Release MES Documentation & Source Code

articles.description: After years being used by Ubuntu Server/Cloud, Ubuntu 23.10 began making use of Canonical's Netplan declarative network configuration software and now Netplan is fully ready to take on all duties with Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. After seven years of development, Netplan 1.0 is ready for primetime use from servers to desktops...
articles.title: Netplan 1.0 Is Ready To Go For Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.description: Last week being surprised to see a number of AMD EPYC performance gains with Linux 6.9 using that in-development kernel, I was curious about what other platforms may be benefiting from better performance on this kernel that will debut as stable in May. This week I turned to running some fresh benchmarks of Intel Xeon Max using the Supermicro Hyper SuperServer SYS-221H-TNR. articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Respawn Entertainment rolled out an update that addresses matchmaking in Apex Legends Ranked, fixes an issues with badges, and more. 


On April 3, an Apex Legends update went awry, as players lost Heirlooms and progression. Respawn Entertainment sprung into action fast and released a hot fix before the end of that day, resolving everything beside the incorrect badges displaying in Ranked. So, the devs came back and delivered another update on April 8. Previously earned badges will now display the correct rank, and the patch also included a few surprises. 


The most recent Apex Legends update addresses Ranked Play matchmaking. Image via EA


The devs reworked Ranked matchmaking so parties now have a limit of a three-rank tier difference between players. For example, a Diamond player won't be able to squad with someone in Bronze, and vice versa. This should prevent high-leveled competitors from trying to manipulate the system to get easier matches. 


The update also fixed a connection error called labeled "Code:Cloud" when a player tried to reconnect after a crash. Additionally, community members can now correctly see previews of gifts when receiving them. Finally, the update made various minor fixes for localization, items, and cosmetics to iron out any lingering impact from the previous scare, and Switch users should have a more stable experience when trying to play Apex Legends.  


Players no longer have to worry about losing their progression when logging in, and this update should make Ranked feel like a more balanced experience. Between the recent slip-up, and the worrying hack that happened during the Apex Legends Global Series tournament at the end of March, hopefully the battle royale title can go at least a few weeks without scaring community members. 

The post Apex Legends update puts restrictions on Ranked parties and fixes badges glitch appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Apex Legends update puts restrictions on Ranked parties and fixes badges glitch

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Diving into Warzone's Rebirth Island today immediately caused a stir of confusion for me, as the skies began to dim throughout the match. At first, I believed it to be a new Call of Duty bug or something wrong with my file until I made an embarrassing conclusion: Oh, right, it's the solar eclipse today.


Even though it took me a while to put two and two together, it was pleasing to see the skies changing hues — well, at least for the moment after I got shot at for looking at the pretty colors. If you want a front-row seat for this event, go to Rebirth Island in Warzone and wait for the solar eclipse. It won't happen immediately, so survive as long as possible until you see that stunning picturesque shot. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


Warzone's Rebirth Island solar eclipse update doesn't do much gameplay-wise. There are no unique objectives to complete, nor is there a mission to take down the Fire Lord for those Avatar: The Last Airbender fans out there. The update is merely for appearance purposes, but it could be used to your advantage. Given that the sky goes dark, it's a perfect time to unleash a sneak attack while the solar eclipse triggers. 


Some players mentioned that there were no Contracts or Loot Caches during this Season 3 event. However, this particular feature seems to have been patched, and I have even confirmed that myself. 


While it is fascinating to gaze at Warzone's solar eclipse update, remember that the match is still ongoing. Just don't make the same mistakes as I did, and try to step away from the high-active player zones. Unfortunately, the event will likely conclude today, so capture its beauty before it's over. 

The post Warzone’s Rebirth Island gets a new look with solar eclipse update appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Warzone’s Rebirth Island gets a new look with solar eclipse update

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
With the 1.6 update, the Mastery system was introduced to Stardew Valley. There’s a Mastery for each skill and when you achieve it, you gain unique rewards that aren’t available from any other source. After unlocking the Mining Mastery, you get one particularly useful perk-giving addition for your farm. 


The Statue of the Dwarf King can be placed on your farm and interacted with once a day to gain a perk that will benefit you when mining. There are five individual perks, but you can only choose from two predetermined perks each day. Restarting the game or having multiple Statues of the Dwarf King will not provide alternative options. 


To build a Statue of the Dwarf King, you’ll need 20 Iridium Bars. 


Statue of the Dwarf King buffs


Screenshot by Destructoid


Buff
Information


+1 ore when mining nodes
This buff works both inside and outside of the mine, increasing the number of drops from each node by one.


Increased chance to find Geodes
Increases the chance of a Geode dropping from rocks both inside and outside of the Mines by 25% either by hand or with bombs. Doesn’t affect Supply Crates on Beach Farm.


Increased chance to find Coal
In any scenario where Coal would regularly drop, the chance of Coal dropping is increased by 3%. This effect stacks with the increase provided by the Prospector profession. Doesn’t affect creation of Coal in a Charcoal Kiln.


Increased chance to find ladder and shafts
Increases the chance of ladders and shafts dropping in the mines:
- From rocks: 25%
- From monsters 7%


Immune to bomb damage
Immune to all damage from Cherry Bombs, Bombs and Mega Bombs both inside and outside of the Mines.





The post How to get and use the Statue of the Dwarf King in Stardew Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get and use the Statue of the Dwarf King in Stardew Valley

articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Modern Warfare 3 regularly uses codes that give players an opportunity to claim free operator skins, weapon blueprints, charms, stickers, XP tokens, and more. Here is everything you need to know about adding free cosmetic items to your collection. 


The season three update introduced a new battle pass featuring a whole new host of cosmetic items, including a Snoop Dogg operator skin, two new weapons, and more. Community members will get plenty of new customization options from progressing through each battle pass tier, but there is also another way to get new goodies for free. Without further ado, let's take a look at the redeem code process. 


How to redeem Call of Duty code in Modern Warfare 3


MW3 redeem codes usually don't last long, so get them while you can. | Image via Activision


Here is a step-by-step on how to redeem a code in MW3. 



Log in to your Activision account on the Call of Duty website


After logging in, go to the redeem page


Type in the code with the correct spelling and capitalization


Hit “REDEEM CODE” to claim your reward



If the code is correct, players will receive a confirmation message. If not, users must double-check the code's accuracy, validity, and region compatibility. Activision Support is always available to assist users struggling with persistent issues. It's important to note that, depending on which platform you are on, there may also be a secondary code to redeem on the PlayStation Store, Xbox Live Marketplace, Steam, or Battle.net. 

The post How to redeem Call of Duty code in Modern Warfare 3 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to redeem Call of Duty code in Modern Warfare 3

articles.author: Alex Van Aken
articles.description:
Last summer, we sat down with Sonic Team Creative Officer Takashi Iizuka to discuss his multi-decade career at Sega. We learn about his childhood fascination with becoming a manga artist, the transition from college life to working at Sega, and his early career developing games like Devi and Pii, Golden Axe 3, and Sonic the Hedgehog 3. Iizuka remembers the excitement and challenge during the transition from the Sega Genesis (known as the Sega Mega Drive in Japan) to the Sega Saturn, which allowed the team progress from 2D pixel art to 3D polygonal modeling.
Notably, the Sonic the Hedgehog lead reflects on the early Dreamcast days, moving to the United States to better implement western culture into Sonic Adventure 2, and finally, describes his emotions after hearing Sega was exiting the hardware business and ending production of the Dreamcast. 
Sonic the Hedgehog Lead Reflects on SEGA's Road to Dreamcast:


Please subscribe to Game Informer's YouTube channel if you enjoy this video. Looking for more interviews like this? Check out Game Informer's interview with Sonic Team's Katie Chrzanowski detailing the making of The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog.
articles.title: Sonic The Hedgehog Lead Reflects On SEGA's Road To The Dreamcast

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Fallout, Amazon Prime’s TV adaptation of Bethesda’s popular RPG, is set to premiere this week on April 11. However, it looks like a second season is already in the works. 
Variety reports (thanks, Eurogamer) that The California Film Commission has awarded $152 million in tax incentives to a dozen TV shows across various studios to lure production of those series into the state. $25 million of these tax credits has been allocated to Fallout's second season, so production is now expected to take place in California. Fallout’s $153 million budget is the largest of any show on this list
Season 1 was largely filmed in New York, with some production in Utah. However, as Variety notes, receiving this tax credit does not guarantee Amazon will accept it and relocate Fallout's production to California for Season 2.


Fallout premieres on Amazon Prime Video on Thursday, April 11. The eight-episode series is directed by Westworld showrunners Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joy, with Bethesda head Todd Howard serving as executive producer. The cast includes Ella Purnell, Walton Goggins, Kyle MacLachlan, and Aaron Moten. The show’s synopsis reads
[Source: Variety]
Will you be checking out Fallout this week? Let us know in the comments!
articles.title: Amazon’s Fallout Series Primed For Second Season Ahead Of Premiere

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Bandai Namco, the publisher of Elden Ring and the developer behind this year's Tekken 8, has quietly released three small 3D platformers for free. Available to download right now on Steam, Nottolot, Doronko Wanko, and Boomeroad are 3D platformers released on March 26, and all three were developed by Bandai Namco, as pointed out by Dominic Tarason on X (formerly Twitter). 
In Nottolot, a free-play robot hacking action game, players control Rolly, who uses a hacking ability to control four enemies and escape from a robot production factory. There are 52 reviews for it on Steam so far, giving the game a "Very Positive" rating.


Boomeroad is described as an exhilarating action-adventure game in which players slide along boomerang rails they create. "The game is set in an ancient ruin floating…
articles.title: Bandai Namco Has Quietly Released Three Small 3D Platformers For Free

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Players have defeated the entire enemy Automaton bot faction in Helldivers 2, making Operation Swift Disassembly a success. Now, with one of the game's two enemy factions wiped from the galactic map, players wonder what developer Arrowhead Game Studios has in store for them. 
Last week, a new major order called Operation Swift Disassembly was doled out to Helldivers, tasking Super-Earth's finest soldiers to annihilate the Automaton Legion. Days later, the Automatons are no more and Operation Swift Disassembly is complete. The studio congratulated players with the following message on X (formerly Twitter), and while it looks great on the surface, many are wary of what Arrowhead might have planned next. 
You did it, Helldivers. Operation Swift Disassembly was a success! With the bots eradicated and bugs contained, the galaxy is free once more. pic.twitter.com/W7GolbDmHW
April 7, 2024
Sure, the galaxy is free...for now. If you've been playing Helldivers 2 since launch, you know players are likely just days away from some new galactic horror, Automaton re-emergence, or something even more terrifying. Of course, there's the funnier timeline where this just means Helldivers 2 is done and Arrowhead turns off the servers, as many have joked about online, but with so much momentum for the game, there's no shot this is the end. 
In the meantime, read about the Democratic Detonation premium Warbond that drops into Helldivers 2 this week, and then read about how the latest Helldivers 2 update increased the level cap, added blizzards and sandstorms, and more. Check out Game Informer's Helldivers 2 review to find out why we think it's a must-play game. 
Did you help erase the Automaton Legion? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Players Have Defeated An Entire Enemy Faction In Helldivers 2

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Wrestlemania 40 is nearly upon us, and if you’ve been following WWE for the past three years, the show, like nearly every story during this time, revolves around one family: the Bloodline. The massive family tree of Samoan wrestlers dates back decades and includes members such as current undisputed champion Roman Reigns, Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson, Yokozuna, Rikishi, and so many others. In a business filled with famous families, the Bloodline is likely the biggest family dynasty in pro wrestling history. 
That got me thinking of similar family trees across all of video game fiction and if any of them could stand toe-to-toe against the Bloodline. I’ve gathered up a few worthy clans, and while we’ll never see them square off against Roman’s fam for dominance, we can at least hypothesize who w…
articles.title: Could These Video Game Families Beat WWE’s Bloodline?

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
After The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time reinvented the series in 3D and became its new gold standard, Nintendo followed up with a surreal sequel in Majora's Mask. Set two months after the events of Ocarina, Link finds himself transported to an alternate version of Hyrule called Termina and must prevent a very angry moon from crashing into the Earth over the course of three constantly repeating days. Majora's Mask's unique structure and bizarre tone have earned it legions of passionate defenders and detractors, and one long-time Zelda fan is going to experience it for the first time to see where he lands on that spectrum.
Join Marcus Stewart and Kyle Hilliard today and each Friday on Twitch at 2 p.m. CT as they gradually work their way through the entire game until Termina is saved. Archived episodes will be uploaded each Saturday on our second YouTube channel Game Informer Shows, which you can watch both above and by clicking the links below. 
Part 1 - Plenty of Time
Part 2 - The Bear
Part 3 - Deku Ball Z
Part 4 - Pig Out
Part 5 - The Was a Bad Choice!
Part 6 - Ray Darmani
Part 7 - Curl and Pound
Part 8 - Almost a Flamethrower
Part 9 - Take Me Higher
Part 10 - Time Juice
Watch on Twitch!
If you enjoy our livestreams but haven’t subscribed to our Twitch channel, know that doing so not only gives you notifications and access to special emotes. You’ll also be granted entry to the official Game Informer Discord channel, where our welcoming community members, moderators, and staff gather to talk games, entertainment, food, and organize hangouts! Be sure to also follow our second YouTube channel, Game Informer Shows, to watch other Replay episodes as well as Twitch archives of GI Live and more.
articles.title: The Legend Of Zelda: Majora's Mask Part 10 | Super Replay

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Publisher Ubisoft and developer Massive Entertainment has revealed that a new Star Wars Outlaws story trailer will be released next week. We'll be seeing more of protagonist Kay Vess and her trusty (and adorably cute) companion Nix on Tuesday, April 9, at 9 a.m. PT/Noon ET. 
As for what to expect, Ubisoft hasn't shared anything in that regard. It simply says the story trailer is arriving next week and that it will be published on YouTube. 
Watch the World Premiere of the Star Wars Outlaws Story Trailer. Join us at 9AM PST / 6PM CET.
April 5, 2024
This story trailer is our next taste of Star Wars Outlaws, an open-world adventure set between Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back and Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi. It was announced during an Xbox Games Showcase last June and further showcased with gameplay at a Ubisoft Forward the same month. You can read more about the game in our preview of it here, and you can read this exclusive interview with the game's narrative director about what to expect. 
Star Wars Outlaws is due out sometime this year on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. 
Are you excited for Star Wars Outlaws? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: A New Star Wars Outlaws Story Trailer Is Coming Next Week

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Front Mission 2: Remake is coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC later this month. More specifically, the previously Switch-exclusive remake will hit these new platforms on April 30. 
Released back in October on Switch, Front Mission 2: Remake is the first time Western players have been able to play through this tactics/strategy RPG since the game's original Japan-only release in 1997. It's set 12 years after Front Mission 1st: Remake, which hit Switch in November 2022 and other platforms in June of last year, and puts players in control of Ash, an O.C.U soldier trying to escape the overrun nation of Alordesh. However, in this escape, Ash learns of a much broader conspiracy. 
Check out the Front Mission 2: Remake release date trailer for yourself below: 


Like the Switch version, Front Mission 2: Remake on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC features improved loading times compared to the original, free camera movement, a revamped soundtrack, new customization options, and extra language support. 
Starting April 15, PC players can check out a free demo of Front Mission 2: Remake on Steam. Developer and publisher Forever Entertainment says saved game data from the demo will carry over to the full game upon its release later this month. 
Front Mission 2: Remake hit Switch back in October; it hits PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC on April 30. 
Are you going to check out Front Mission 2: Remake later this month? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Switch Exclusive Front Mission 2: Remake Marches To PlayStation, Xbox, And PC This Month

Gameplay and screenshots from a canceled Batman game set in the universe of Christopher Nolan's Dark Knight trilogy and developed by Monolith Productions have leaked online. The leaked footage and images, which were posted on Twitter by Dageekydude with information learned from DidYouKnowGaming, Andrew4586 on Twitter, an internet archive, and some developer portfolios, showcase a game that reportedly eventually became Monolith's Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, nemesis system and all. 
Codenamed Project Apollo, this Nolanverse Batman game would have featured the likeness of Christian Bale's Dark Knight, the "Tumbler" Batmobile, plenty of gadgets, and a unique spin on the Caped Crusader's detective work. 
The thread starts below with a look at Batman and the Tumbler. Dageekydude then shows o…
articles.title: Footage Of Monolith's Canceled Nolan Batman Game That Became Shadow Of Mordor Appears Online

We drill into Pepper Grinder, the latest title from Devolver Digital, and then discuss a rad town-building sandbox called Summerhouse. Publisher Microids and newcomer developer Savage Level have revealed Flint: Treasure of Oblivion, a turn-based tactical RPG set in a world of piracy. This swashbuckling debut from Savage Level is due out in Q4 of this year on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, and if today's debut trailer is any indication, it looks like a game worth keeping a spyglass on. 
Savage Level describes Flint as a double-A game that takes inspiration from one of piracy's most famed fictional stories: Treasure Island.
"Prepare to weigh anchor alongside Captain Flint, his trusty first mate Billy Bones, and their crew of seasoned sea dogs as they set sail in search of a legendary treasure promisin' freedom and fortune," a press release reads. "With a yarn spun in the traditional style of comic strips, Flint: Tr…
articles.title: Flint: Treasure Of Oblivion Is A Turn-Based Tactical RPG Set In A World Of Piracy

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Stellar Blade director Kim Hyung Tae has announced that developer ShiftUp's upcoming action game, Stellar Blade, will get a New Game+ mode sometime after launch. Plus, Tae says there will be no microtransactions in the game, save for one theoretical exception. 
This news comes from a new interview with Korean publication Ruliweb, where Tae explained that while Stellar Blade will have a New Game+ mode at some point, it won't be available at launch, as translated by Genki_JPN on Twitter. Tae also told Ruliweb that players should not expect any microtransactions in Stellar Blade, but notes that one exception would be paid collaborations with another company's IP. 


"We want to make it clear at this point that Stellar Blade will not require any additional expenses that gamers are not aware of beyond what they paid for the package," Tae told Ruliweb. "The only exception is if we create collaboration costumes with another company's IP; those may be sold for a fee. Also, there is no New Game+ in the launch version, so please look forward to it being updated very soon." 
Given that no collaborations have been announced at this point, Tae is likely just checking bases for hypothetical collaborations ShiftUp may or may not be pursuing. At any rate, given the popularity of ShiftUp's Goddess of Victory: NIKKE game on mobile devices, it's possible we see an internal collaboration between those two properties. 
Stellar Blade is an action game launching on PlayStation 5 exclusively on April 26. It was announced in 2021 as Project EVE. There is a demo for Stellar Blade available on PSN that you can download right now if you're curious about how the game plays. 
For more, read Game Informer's Stellar Blade feature for behind-the-scenes details and new insight from Tae. 
[Source: Ruliweb]
Are you excited for Stellar Blade? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Stellar Blade Director Reveals New Game Plus Mode, Says No Microtransactions With One Exception

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc

Developer Pocketpair has released a new Palworld update that introduces the game's first raid boss, makes changes to pals, U.I., and bases, and more. Dubbed v0.2.0.6, the Steam version of this update for PC players is already live; the Xbox version will be released when it's ready, according to Pocketpair. 
As for what to expect, today's update is one of Palworld's biggest. But chief among the additions is the game's first raid boss, a heavily anticipated aspect of the survival game's endgame. Let's break it all down: 
Raid Boss

You can summon raid boss pals by using slabs at new Summoning Altars
These pals are extremely powerful and cannot be captured. 
Pal eggs can drop after defeating raid boss pals. 
There is an "extreme" version of the first ra…
articles.title: New Palworld Update Includes First Raid Boss, Pal And Base Changes, And More

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Uniqlo stores currently offer Capcom-inspired clothes that feature the likes of Street Fighter 6, Resident Evil 4, and more, alongside other items of apparel inspired by Konami's Metal Gear Solid series. Now, Uniqlo has revealed The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is the next game to get the t-shirt treatment.
The clothes will launch in Japan this month – Uniqlo is based in Japan – before a release in the West happens at some point in the future, as reported by VideoGamesChronicle. As for when exactly to expect these shirts to hit the states, though, that remains unknown. 
The Tears of the Kingdom line consists of six shirts, and you can check each out in the gallery below: 

On the Japanese website for Uniqlo, each of these shirts is listed for 1,500 Yen, which converts to less than $10 a shirt. However, the price could be raised when these shirts come to Uniqlo stores in the states. 
For more, read Game Informer's review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, and then read about how the game has crossed more than 20 million sales in less than a year. After that, check out this story about how Super Nintendo World is coming to Florida in Universal's new Epic Universe theme park next year. 
What do you think of these Tears of the Kingdom shirts? Let us know which ones you want to pick up in the comments below!
articles.title: Uniqlo Reveals New Line Of T-Shirts Inspired By The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
A fresh new batch of Senua's Saga: Hellblade II previews have dropped today, which is how we learned Ninja Theory co-founder and Hellblade director-writer Anteem Antoniades is no longer at the studio. It's also how we learned the game will run at 30 FPS on Xbox Series X/S. 
Speaking to German publication GamePro, Hellblade II visual effects director Mark Slater-Tunstill confirmed the game will run at 30 FPS alongside dynamic scaling on Xbox Series X/S, as reported by Wccftech. Slater-Tunstill told GamePro the 30 FPS makes sense with the game's more cinematic nature. However, if you're after higher frames, a beefier PC can likely accomplish that. 


Regardless of frames, Hellblade II is sure to be stunning visually. Developed in Epic Games' Unreal Engine 5, Ninja Theory told Polygon this engine has allowed the game's more realistic nature to be achievable, thanks to its Nanite geometry system and because "the turnaround between scanning the thing and putting it in the level is drastically cut, and you can spend that time finessing." Be sure to read Polygon's full Hellblade II preview for more details on what to expect visually from this game. 
Hellblade II hits Xbox Series X/S and PC on May 21. 
For more, watch the latest Hellblade II trailer here, and then read about Hellblade II's photo mode and what to expect from it at launch. After that, watch this Hellblade II gameplay trailer. 
[Source: Wccftech via GamePro]
Are you playing Hellblade II on Xbox Series X/S or PC? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Senua's Saga: Hellblade II Locked To 30 FPS On Xbox Series X/S, According To VFX Director

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Ninja Theory co-founder and Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice writer and director Anteem Antoniades has left the company. This news comes from a new Polygon preview of Ninja Theory's upcoming release, Senua's Saga: Hellblade II, which hits Xbox Series X/S and PC on May 21, as reported by VideoGamesChronicle. 
Polygon noticed during a hands-on preview of Hellblade II at Ninja Theory's Cambridge, U.K.-based studio that there was no trace of Antoniades. A spokesperson for Xbox confirmed later that Antoniades was no longer working at Ninja Theory.


"On my visit, there was no sign or mention of Ninja Theory's flamboyant founder and Hellblade writer-director Tameem Antoniades," Polygon writes in its Hellblade II preview. "An Xbox spokesperson later confirmed to Polygon that he is no longer with the studio. Antoniades was involved in Hellblade 2 in the early stages, but the game now has a trio of creative leads: environment art director Dan Attwell, visual effects director Mark Slater-Tunstill, and audio director David Garcia." 
Beyond the Hellblade series, Antoniades also worked on Ninja Theory's Heavenly Sword, Enslaved: Odyssey to the West, and DmC: Devil May Cry. 
Hellblade II hits Xbox Series X/S and PC on May 21. 
For more, watch the latest Hellblade II trailer here, and then read about Hellblade II's photo mode and what to expect from it at launch. After that, watch this Hellblade II gameplay trailer. 
[Source: VideoGamesChronicle via Polygon]
Are you picking up Hellblade II on day one next month? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Ninja Theory Co-Founder, Hellblade Director Tameem Antoniades No Longer At Studio

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes, the popular free-to-play Star Wars collectible turn-based strategy RPG mobile game, is coming to PC with cross-save functionality and improved performance. Speaking with the developer over e-mail, the team says, "We have been able to double the frame rate to 60 fps, added anti-aliasing, and implemented higher resolution settings so that players can take advantage of the power of a high-end PC." The game's layout has also been adjusted for the PC version.
Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes originally launched for mobile devices back in 2015, and has amassed a following over the years. In that time, players have figured out ways to emulate the game on PC, but this will be an official release. Along with improved visuals, the game will also support mouse and keyboard as well as keybinds (unfortunately "there is no controller support at this time"). Longtime players will also be able to bring all their progress over by linking their mobile account to their EA account when playing on PC for the first time, and all future updates will release on both mobile and PC platforms simultaneously. The teams says, "The PC and mobile version will always be in lockstep and release updates at the same time."
Beta access for the PC version will be available for current mobile players in May before expanding to a larger audience. From the developer: "For those interested, they can head to the Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes website, sign up for the EA App, link their account, and they are now ready to register. There’s a dedicated registration page that can be found on the website the day registration begins! For those selected, you will be receiving an invite via email for access to the Closed Beta." You can learn more here.
articles.title: Star Wars: Galaxy Of Heroes Is Coming To PC With A Better Framerate And Higher Resolution

articles.author: Brian Shea
